title: Wonderful Meal - excellent for pre-show audience
text:
We had the Filet, Schezwan Long Beans, Asparagus and Mashed Potatoes. Everything was perfect. We probably ordered to much as the portions are a decent size but it is so hard to choose. I will say my favorite was the long beans but as noted before EVERYTHING was wonderful.

We dined here before going to the Ahmanson and it is an easy walk between the two if you are so inclined.

title: Loved this museum
text: The quality and presentation of the items here is well executed. You will see many classic pieces (including the pieces that have been repatriated from the Getty Museum. Plan on spending some time here.

title: Nice airline - but watch for the carry-on requirements
text: This was a great airline but their carry on restrictions are strict. When checking into my flight they checked the weight and you guessed it I was overweight so I ended up paying the $60.00 checked bag fee. While I saw may passengers that had bags that were siimilar size and weight they did not have the same issue - it does make you wonder why some people are picked out and others are not (I was not alone in having to go and pay)

title: Tight quarters
text: The leg room is a tight but that is true of most airlines now if you are flying economy. I was not surprised the flight was crowded but I am sure most of the others on my flight probably booked as I did for the lowest price offered on a flight to Athens. Given what I paid I have not complaints.

title: Beautiful setting
text: The main reason to go here is how beautiful the setting is. One side of this restaurant serves food the other side is for drinks. The food is good but not exceptional but it is so nice to sit here under the trees and enjoy your meal or drinks.

title: Iconic
text: This is a must see on any visit to Athens. The acropolis is currently under renovation to preserve this historic site but that does not diminish the overall experience by much. The Temple of Athena Nike, The Parthenon, The Odeon, and Theater are all part of this site. As you can expect this to be crowded I recommend coming either first thing in the morning or later in the afternoon (closes at sunset).

title: Amazing museum
text: This very modern museum is a real treat. The items are so beautifully displayed and well thought out. You not only have the museum but below is the old city they are still excavating which you can walk through. Make the effort to come here - you will not be disappointed.

title: Exceeded expectations for a quick meal
text: The atmosphere may a little lacking - but the food is great! My friend and I really enjoyed everything we every ordered here. The food is fresh and delicious. There are so many options it can be hard to choose. I came here every morning of my stay here to get a coffee and pastry of some type. They have both sweet and savory options. I tried and like both options. But because the breakfast items were so good we also came here to get dinner a couple of times and were not disappointed! The articoke hearts with potatoes were amazing!!! I also enjoyed the Moussaka. The prices here were extremely affordable so if you want some delicious food at a great price this is a great place to go.

title: Beautiful
text: While the bus trip is not short going to Delphi was worth it. I enjoyed hearing more about the history of the various items located at the site in addiion to the information I already knew about Delphi. The views from here are spectacular especially if you hike all the way up to the stadium. The museum is also worth a visit. The items on display are well displayed in a modern building to show them in their best light.

title: Exceeded All Expectations
text:
This trip was one of the best trips I have ever taken! The side hikes off the river show the diversity of the area and lead to beautiful waterfalls, vistas, and just cool places to hang out and listen to music provided by our guides! If you can I would ask to have Cliff and Oliver (both musicians) and have so much information about the canyon that you will be amazed. You experience both peaceful moments and exciting rapids on this trip. You have the option to sit in the front portion of the boat (the wet zone) or towards the rear for a little more comfort and much drier. The meals provided are cooked at camp by the guides and are of good quality with an excellent variety. They also accomodate for vegetarian and vegan rafters if you advise them in advance.

Our group all got along which made the experience even better - you could not ask for more. This trip is good for couples, singles, friends, and families.

I highly recommend this outfitter!

If you want to see the entire canyon from beginning to end in 7 days in the motorized raft. If you have more time you may want to consider the 14 day raft trip - but I found the 7 day trip to be just the right amount of time.

title: Worth the hike to see
text: This is a lovely historic home on Emerald Bay. If you get the chance to come make sure to take the tour and hear the story of when and how it was built and see the home which still has approximately 80% of the original furniture.

title: Great Sandwiches
text:
The sandwiches we ordered here were excellent! They were made with good quality ingredients and are very large. We ordered the Club Subs with Avocado and could not have been happier! They are off the main highway but worth finding. This was recommended to us by a local - and they were right - the best sandwiches we had in South Lake Tahoe.

You should note that this is a cash only business but it is worth making sure you have the cash to get your food here.

title: Amazing! Try to see at night if possible!
text: This is a beautiful memorial which is worth seeing - but if you really want the full experience see it at night. The way they have this lit makes it even more dramatic and the message that more impressive. I love that you might wonder at first why the statue looks like it is unfinished - that of course is not the case that is the artists way of expressing that the work that was started by Martin Luther King Jr. is still not done.

title: Vegetarian and vegan options
text:
Our group had mixed requirements in terms of food options and this restaurant was able to accomodate us all. It is a converted gas station which has been nicely renovated. Casual and comfortable with both indoor and outdoor seating. I tried a "Beyond Burger"
and it was delicious! Would go here again if I come back to Pittsburgh.

title: Nice place to visit if you are in the area
text: You will enjoy this more if you are a fan of Warhol. I happen to enjoy his work and was happy to see what they had on display. There are interactive exhibits which are also fun to play around with like Screen Test" or the floating silver mylar pillows. I was sad that some of my favorite pieces by him were not present, but still enjoyed what I did see overall. If you are comimg with children you may wish to skip the film portion.

title: Fun, Ecclectic Art Museum - Beautiful Inside and Out
text:
This is a beautiful reuse of industrial space turned into museum. The pieces made by mostly self taught artists and are displayed very effectively so you can experience them at their best. Some very thought provoking pieces and some just for fun pieces!

Don't forget to stop in the gift shop it is as much fun as the museum.

title: Excellent! Must see!
text:
This is a beautifully made and planned museum. Expect to spent at least 4 hours here to go through the main exhibits. The items are presented in such an engaging way with not only the artifact but many well done videos and interactive displays.
If you know when you will be visiting please go online and set up your timed entrance pass. If the day you are able to come is not available you can go online the same day at 6:30am and try to get a same day ticket.
Make the effort and go see this museum.
place: National Museum of African American History and Culture

title: The beauty of simplicity
text: This memorial will take your breath away in its simple beauty and meaning. Take your time and learn how the names are presented and the meaning of the slightly bolder names.

title: Try visiting this in the evening for the dramatic effect.
text: This is well thought out memorial that is truly deceptive at first - but as you walk around you not only see the figures in the grass but you will notice the wall with photos of actual soldiers taken during the war. I have seen this both in the day and at night and I think that an evening viewing is the most memorable.

title: A must see Iconic Memorial
text: We saw this in the evening and it is beautifully lite at night. There is a small series of rooms to the side with additional information and an elevator should you need one.

title: Excellent tour and informative guide!
text: The evening tour was the most enjoyable evening we had in Washington DC. We we picked up from our hotel along with another couple, Our guide/proprietor Brian is very charming and knowledgable. You visit the sites and are regaled with stories of historical interest and it is a blast. I can not recommend this tour enough.
place: Epic Washington DC Evening Tour: Small-Group Van Tour

title: Fun boat ride up to the Napili Coast
text: We took the sunset tour up the Napili Coast and this was a great boat ride with a wonderful crew! Captain Drew, Jess, and Jay were extremely helpful and knowledgeable. They serve appetizers and drinks on the way up the coast and dinner and drinks on the way back. I would highly recommend this if you are looking to do a boat tour. Also if you are a Costco member you can buy discount ticket vouchers online and save yourself a little cash! Highly recommend.

title: Nice casual restaurant on the beachfront
text: This restaurant is the same as the one in La Jolla, California. Beautiful casual restaurant with ocean views. The food is good and there is always a wait. The more casual eating is on the ground floor with the bar/patio/koi pond area. Upstairs is the more formal dinning room with more food options. This is an easy drive from the airport and makes a great place to go eat either before or after a flight.

title: Who does not like a good looking Tiki Bar/Restaurant
text: As you can guess the name gives away the motif and this one is done beautifully. Located in the Princeville center it is one of the only places in the area to stay open on the late side. The food was good - we had mixed plates (love mixed plates). This place is good for lunch or dinner - or even just an evening cocktail.

title: Beautiful views with good food.
text: This is a very popular spot up in the Princeville area. There is a lively bar (3:00pm-9:00pm) and restaurant with the best view. The atmosphere is casual but comfortable. The food was very good and I believe this is run by the same people who own and run the Calypso restaurant in Hanalei. Will come back here again next time we are on Kauai.

title: Best dinner we had on the island
text: The food here is excellent. This was recommended to us by a couple who live on Kauai and they were not wrong. The restaurant itself if lovely with a beautiful view of the ocean. There is a 5 course tasting menu if you arrive from 5:00-5:45 that everyone raves about but sorry to say we missed this. But what we did have was wonderful (chefs special fish & mushroom meatloaf). I would recommend making reservations if at all possible as this is a very popular spot that fills up quickly (it opens for dinner at 5:00pm)

title: Mediterranian!
text: We love this place! We ordered a few different dishes and shared family style. There is not a single thing that we did not enjoy. The food is fresh and flavorful! If you love Mediterranean food you will love this restaurant. Just an FYI this restaurant is on the smaller side and is a little hidden but worth finding.

title: Great Lunch spot
text: Just a heads up this place does not stay open very long past lunch but try and get here as the food is excellent! We had the chicken salad on a croissant and the stuffed avocado salad. These were delicious to say the least.

title: Best place to stay in the Coachella Valley!
text: This resort is not like most as most of the rooms are spacious casitas. Our room was large with a seating area in front of the fire place, table/desk and King bed. the bathroom was great with a nice tub and separate shower in a room separate from the large vanity room with closet. The décor is tasteful and a reference to the historic structures here on site. There is a lovely spa, gym, tennis courts, pickle ball and of course golf! There is a practice putting green behind the Lobby building and we enjoyed the 7:00 am fitness walk. You can't go wrong staying here!
place: La Quinta Resort & Club, A Waldorf Astoria Resort

title: Quality food with good service.
text: This place was better than we anticipated! The food was excellent and the flavors were perfect. My friend loves Mexican food but can not eat cilantro but her special request was no problem here. The servings are on the large side so if you are a light eater you may want to share. I would recommend the tamales as you can tell they were hand made - exceptionally light and perfect seasoning. I plan on coming back here the next time I am in Tuscon.

title: Great Setting - Delicious Food and Craft Beer
text: This was quite surprising. I expected to see the brewery (we also did the brewery tour while we were here) and thought the restaurant would be nice but maybe not my first choice in terms of ambiance - but I was wrong! This place is beautiful and you would never know from the street what is in store for you once you enter. The restaurant is well designed and the food is excellent! I loved the indoor/outdoor aspect and the gardens are beautiful and fun to go walk through. They did have some live music while we were there and that made sitting out in the garden with a drink very enjoyable after eating dinner. Would highly recommend this.

title: Amazing
text: I was not sure what to expect when I booked the guided tour offered by the GIA but it was exceptional. If you love gems and minerals or just want to learn more this is a great place to go. The guided tour is the only way to go in my opinion as the guide is well versed in the mission of the GIA and all that they represent. You see some amazing work (jewelry, photography, loose stones, etc.) and also get a peek at some classes in progress - it was very informative. So if you find yourself in Carlsbad and can make the guided tour (you must reserve in advance and make sure you bring your ID) I would recommend your taking the time to do this.

title: Farm to Table
text:
The food here is wonderful. I had the Yukon Gold Potato Gnocchi which was exceptional! This dish had forest mushrooms, snap peas and onion with the best gnocchi I have had (including Italy). My husband had the Kale Salad and our friends had the Grassfed Burgers. Everyone enjoyed their meals. As with most restaurants in this area the prices are not cheap but in line with what a good meal costs today.
Since the produce is from the farm sometimes you can not get what you want. One of our friends was not able to get fresh tomato slices as they were already out of them that day. This restaurant itself is beautiful the main dining room is charming the outside is lovely and you can walk the actual gardens and see the live fire grill.
I will be returning here again.

title: Beautiful Setting
text: This is a lovely setting very green with a lovely creek running by. Easy access to Slide Creek and Sedona? There is something you should consider if you are thinking of staying is there are pit toilets but they are well maintained and there are no sinks. There are faucets with potable water. The staff here was very nice and helpful. I would come here again

title: Great food and expansive views
text: This is a beautiful restaurant in a lovely setting. The view here is spectacular! The dishes we had were delicious. The bar is well stocked with friendly bar staff. I highly recommend this restaurant if you are visiting Sedona. Try to come and be here prior to sunset to truely appreciate the view in daylight and twilight.

title: One of the better whole foods
text: This is one of the larger whole foods with a nice bar/dinig area. As always a nice selection of fruits, veggies, and prepared dishes for when you are on the go.

title: Beautiful Views - Spacious Room
text: We stayed at the Sea Ranch Lodge and it was wonderful. The room was large with a view that could take your breath away. The corner window seat was great for taking a break and just looking out at the beautiful coastline or reading - we were in room #10 which is upstairs so make sure you are good with taking the stairs. Be aware that you come here to relax so there is no television but there is Wi-Fi so you are not totally out of touch. There are walking trails directly out from the lodge or if you do not mind a short drive you can park at one of the beach access lots. I would stay here again.

title: Jewel Box by the Sea
text: This is a lovely non-denominational chapel open to all for prayer or meditation. Worth a stop as the craftsmanship is amazing.

title: Walk with the wild flowers
text: The wild flowers were in bloom when we came here so the walk was spectacularly beautiful. This can be a long or short walk depending on your starting or stopping point. Just be careful not to get to close the the edges as there is significant erosion at the edges of the bluffs in areas. Would highly recommend taking the trail if you are in the area.
place: Walk On Beach Sea Ranch Access Trail

title: Views, Views, Views
text: The views from this Inn are spectacular - when you look out you see the ocean, cliffs, and the bridge. The staff is very nice and extremely helpful. You not only get a beautiful room but a lovely breakfast is included with your stay. Also if you are so inclined they have a happy hour at the restaurant from 5-6pm. This is a quiet Inn and there is no television and I did not get cell service but they do have Wi-Fi. I would recommend this to anyone looking to stay in the area and relax.

title: Not Just Pizza
text: This was recommended to us by a local and they were right this was a great place for lunch. They are more than just pizza. They have great salads, sandwiches, and pasta. The lunch specials are also a very good price with good sized portions. I had the cobb salad and pasta which comes with a drink for ten dollars. I will come back here again as it is located in La Quinta Village which is quite pretty to walk through. It can get quite busy and I am sure it is the same at dinner but worth any wait you may encounter.

title: Great pastry and coffee
text: We stopped by here for an afternoon snack after a hike in the local mountains. The coffee was excellent and I would highly recommend their fresh berry tart. The interior is small but there are tables and you can order other dishes besides the pastries. The quiche looked lovely and they do have a full menu.

title: Loved this place! Worth the wait
text: We did have to wait for our table but this place is popular for a reason. We came here for dinner on a Thursday (Frajita specials on Tuesday and Thursday) and shared some frajitas and pork tamales in tomatillo sauce. I can honestly say the tomatillo sauce with the pork tamales far exceeded any expectations I may have had. The prices are fair and if you are so inclined the they have a very popular happy hour. I plan on coming here again on our next visit to the desert.

title: Nice relaxing stay
text: This is a nicely appointed Embassy Suites Hotel. The Lobby is quite nice and the dining area (breakfast and happy hour) is well designed. We stayed on the fourth floor and the room is a little dated but had a lovely view of the mountains. We could have stayed on the first floor which has been remodeled but I prefer the top floor to control noise. I must admit I always appreciate the extra space you get here compared to a standard hotel room. This is within walking distance of the Old La Quinta Village which has cute shops and multiple dining options.
place: Embassy Suites by Hilton La Quinta Hotel & Spa

title: Vegan Brunch
text: The brunch menu on Sundays was excellent! We shared the cheese and grits (this is way better than it sounds) and then each ordered different items. I would say that we were all pleasantly surprised as we had heard some mixed reviews about this restaurant. This is located in a converted former appliance store and is a few blocks from the Museum of Latin American Art. We will be coming back again when we visit Long Beach.

title: Great Food - but a long wait
text: We enjoyed the breakfast we had here. The food was excellent and a nice change. The presentation of the dishes is excellent. The only negative is the long wait. I plan on eating here again on our next trip to Palm Springs.

title: Clean and quite
text: This is your basic Hampton Inn. Well maintained but this location does not have mini fridges or microwave ovens in the room. There is the standard free breakfast and WiFi. The staff was friendly and courteous.
place: Hampton Inn & Suites Tucson East / Williams Centre

title: Loved it!
text:
A group of us went to Sushi Ran for lunch and it was truly amazing. We shared the seaweed salad, crunch roll, kaisen futo-maki, and the tempura udon noodle. We loved it all!

The location is just off the main tourist street in Sausalito.

If you are having a yen for sushi and are nearby make this your stop.

title: Great Pizza and Salad
text:
This place is quite charming and the food was excellent.

We started with the Point Reyes Blue Cheese Organic Salad, and followed that with a Margarita Pizza and a Chicken Sausage Pizza. If you are having the salad as your appetizer (or with your meal) order the small it was enough for four of us since we were having pizza too.

Also they have free donut holes for just a taste of sweetness if you do not have room for that lovely pie!

We came here with our appetites after visiting the beach at Point Reyes and this really hit the spot.

title: Surprisingly Good!
text:
I did not know what to expect as this is a low cost airline - but this was a very pleasant flight. It was a newer Dreamliner and while you do pay for checked baggage (if you have any) or want to choose your seat, these were not a issue for us We were still seated together and the service on the plane was excellent if you needed anything.

If you want food/drinks you can place your order on the touch screen in front of you and pay with your credit card and your items will be brought to you in short order. I thought the prices for the items offered were fair.

This was a very pleasant and cost effective way to travel. I plan to use them again.

title: Good location, friendly and helpful staff
text:
We chose this hotel as it is located in a good part of Rome without being directly in the high traffic tourist area. You have easy access to everything you could want to do from this hotel. You can take a bus/trolley (stop is right in front of the hotel) or you can have the excellent hotel staff call a taxi for you.

You can also walk to a few things (Villa Borghese, Zoo, Art Museum, or Catacombs) if that is something you enjoy.

Rooms are on the small side but they are well thought out and use the space well.

I would stay here again.

title: Must See
text: This is one of the must see locations in Rome. The history of the building alone makes it worth the trip. There is always a line to enter but it is fast moving so do not let that deter you from entering. This is a wonderful stop and the fact that it is free is a bonus.

title: Amazing Villa
text:
This is an amazing venue and worth a visit. If you love art it is worth getting a private guide to explain the finer points of the artwork and history of the villa - which is of note.

Make sure to get your tickets in advance as this is done with timed entry tickets. If you plan it right you should really try and walk the surrounding gardens and park along with enjoying the Villa.

title: Beautiful
text: You can't come to Rome and not see the Trevi Fountain. I came here two times during our visit (once at around 4 pm and the next morning at 8 am) while the morning is less crowded do not think you will be the only one there. But if you are looking to take some pictures the morning still rules.

title: Massive Monument
text:
This is a massive monument in the center of Rome. If you like military history this is a good place to come. There are nice displays of military flags, insignias, and other items.

It also makes a good meeting spot as you can not miss it!

title: Delicious
text:
This restaurant is popular for a good reason - the food is great. I have never been here when there is not a crowd.
This is a seafood restaurant so if anyone in your group is not a seafood eater your options are very limited. But given that for seafood this is the place - fresh fish and excellent sides!
Parking in the area can be tough but there is a two story city lot across the street which works as you are unlikely to find street parking nearby.

title: Great camping on the central coast
text:
We loved our stay here at the San Simeon Creek Campground. While it is right off the highway you do not need to cross over it to reach the beach as there is an under pass which takes you from the campground to the beach. This is a great spot to view wildlife, look for moonstones, or just walk on the beach.

It is located close to Cambria and San Simeon so you will have options for dining out if you choose.

The campground sites are nice and the facility has showers (you will need quarters to use them) that are well maintained.

I plan on coming back again soon.

title: Excellent!
text:
We came here for breakfast at 8:00 am on a Sunday and still had to wait. The food is excellent prepared with fresh ingredients. Our group had a variety of items but I must say my favorite was the ricotta stuffed berry french toast.

Parking can be a challenge even early in the day so keep that in mind - but do not let that deter you from coming.

If you do not want to wait there is a lovely take out portion to this restaurant too.

title: Trendy and Tasty!
text:
This place was packed with happy people enjoying their evening! Great food, excellent drink selection - who could want more. From the exterior you would not guess that this place is as nice as it is - not that it looks bad just that it is a wood and glass exterior located by Whole Foods in a shopping center. but once inside you walk through a gauntlet of wine and then the view explodes into the bar and dining areas - the pillow packed banquets are a nice touch as are the horses strung on wire (acknowledging you are in Del Mar after all) delineating the staircase to the upstairs.

The food was amazing - we ordered family style and shared the chopped salad (escarole, radicchio, casalingo salumi, caciocavallo, shishito, tomato, ceci bean, castelvetrano, crouton, oregano vinaigrette)which was a lovely explosion of tastes. This was accompanied by the triangoli (eggplant, roasted grape, ricotta salata, crispy ceci bean, mint sunflower seed pesto) and the mushroom pizza (mushroom, goat cheese, fried onion, truffle oil).

I highly recommend this restaurant!

title: Scrumptious!
text: We went there on a Saturday on the recommendation of one of the locals and they were right this place is fantastic! While I did not have time to try other types they all looked great - I don't really think you can go wrong with any of their choices.
